docs.lead_paragraph: A new combination of blood tests may allow doctors to screen fetuses for Down syndrome as early as the first trimester of pregnancy, rather than waiting for the second trimester, as is done now. Doctors from the Foundation for Blood Research in Scarborough, Me., found that a combination of two blood tests could detect Down syndrome in about 60 percent of fetuses that have the genetic disease. That is about the same rate of accuracy as tests that are routinely done now in the second trimester.

headline.main: Test Can Detect Fetal Disorder, Study Contends
